com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.location

Class LocationComponentOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.location.LocationComponentOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class LocationComponentOptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    This class exposes options for the Location Component. The options can be set by defining a style in your apps style.xml file and passing in directly into the LocationComponent class. Alternatively, if properties need to be changed at runtime depending on a specific state, you can build an instance of this class, setting the values you desire, and then passing it into either the LocationComponent activation method (if it isn't initialized yet) or LocationComponent.applyStyle(LocationComponentOptions).

    When the createFromAttributes(Context, int) methods called, any attributes not found inside the style will revert back to using their default set values. Likewise, when building a new LocationComponentOptions class using the builder, any options neglecting to be set will reset to their default values.

    If you would like to keep your custom style changes while modifying a single attribute, you can get the currently used options object using LocationComponent.getLocationComponentOptions() and it's toBuilder method to modify a single entry while also maintaining the other settings. Once your modifications have been made, you'll need to pass it back into the location component using LocationComponent.applyStyle(LocationComponentOptions).

    • Method Detail

      • createFromAttributes

        @NonNull
public static LocationComponentOptions createFromAttributes(@NonNull
                                                                     android.content.Context context,
                                                                     @StyleRes
                                                                     int styleRes)
        Construct a new Location Component Options class using the attributes found within a style resource. It's important to note that you only need to define the attributes you plan to change and can safely ignore the other attributes which will be set to their default value.
        Parameters:
        context - your activity's context used for acquiring resources
        styleRes - the style id where your custom attributes are defined
        Returns:
        a new LocationComponentOptions object with the settings you defined in your style resource

      • toBuilder

        @NonNull
public LocationComponentOptions.Builder toBuilder()
        Takes the currently constructed LocationComponentOptions object and provides it's builder with all the values set matching the values in this instance. This allows you to modify a single attribute and then rebuild the object.
        Returns:
        the builder which contains the values defined in this current instance as defaults.

      • builder

        @NonNull
public static LocationComponentOptions.Builder builder(@NonNull
                                                                android.content.Context context)
        Build a new instance of the LocationComponentOptions class with all the attributes set automatically to their defined defaults in this library. This allows you to adjust a few attributes while leaving the rest alone and maintaining their default behavior.
        Parameters:
        context - your activities context used to acquire the style resource
        Returns:
        the builder which contains the default values defined by the style resource

      • backgroundStaleName

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String backgroundStaleName()
        String image name, identical to one used in the first parameter of Style.addImage(String, Bitmap), the component, will use this image in place of the provided or default mapbox_foregroundDrawableStale.

        A maki-icon name (example: "circle-15") may also be provided. These are images that can be loaded with certain styles. Note, this will fail if the provided icon name is not provided by the loaded map style.

        Returns:
        String icon or maki-icon name

      • elevation

        @Dimension
public float elevation()
        Sets the base elevation of this view, in pixels. To turn off the shadow that appears under the location icon, set the elevation to 0. References style attribute R.styleable#LocationComponent_elevation
        Returns:
        the elevation currently set for the location component icon

      • enableStaleState

        public boolean enableStaleState()
        Enable or disable to stale state mode. This mode indicates to the user that the location being displayed on the map hasn't been updated in a specific amount of time. References style attribute R.styleable#LocationComponent_enableStaleState
        Returns:
        whether the stale state mode is enabled or not

      • staleStateTimeout

        public long staleStateTimeout()
        Set the delay before the location icon becomes stale. The timer begins approximately when a new location update comes in and using this defined time, if an update hasn't occured by the end, the location is considered stale. References style attribute R.styleable#LocationComponent_staleStateDelay
        Returns:
        the duration in milliseconds which it should take before the location is considered stale

      • padding

        @Nullable
public int[] padding()
        Sets the distance from the edges of the map view’s frame to the edges of the map view’s logical viewport.

        When the value of this property is equal to {0,0,0,0}, viewport properties such as `centerCoordinate` assume a viewport that matches the map view’s frame. Otherwise, those properties are inset, excluding part of the frame from the viewport. For instance, if the only the top edge is inset, the map center is effectively shifted downward.

        Returns:
        integer array of padding values

      • maxZoomIconScale

        public float maxZoomIconScale()
        The scale factor of the location icon when the map is zoomed in. Scaling is linear.
        Returns:
        icon scale factor

      • minZoomIconScale

        public float minZoomIconScale()
        The scale factor of the location icon when the map is zoomed out. Scaling is linear.
        Returns:
        icon scale factor

      • trackingGesturesManagement

        public boolean trackingGesturesManagement()
        Returns whether gesture threshold should be adjusted when camera is in one of the tracking modes. This will adjust the focal point and increase thresholds to enable camera manipulation, like zooming in and out, without breaking tracking.

        Note: If set to true, this can overwrite some of the gesture thresholds and the custom AndroidGesturesManager that was set with MapboxMap.setGesturesManager(AndroidGesturesManager, boolean, boolean).

        Returns:
        true if gestures are adjusted when in one of the camera tracking modes, false otherwise
        See Also:
        LocationComponentOptions.Builder.trackingInitialMoveThreshold(float), LocationComponentOptions.Builder.trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold(float), LocationComponentOptions.Builder.trackingMultiFingerProtectedMoveArea(RectF)

      • trackingInitialMoveThreshold

        public float trackingInitialMoveThreshold()
        Minimum single pointer movement in pixels required to break camera tracking.
        Returns:
        the minimum movement

      • trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold

        public float trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold()
        Minimum multi pointer movement in pixels required to break camera tracking (for example during scale gesture).
        Returns:
        the minimum movement

      • trackingMultiFingerProtectedMoveArea

        @Nullable
public android.graphics.RectF trackingMultiFingerProtectedMoveArea()
        Protected multi pointer gesture area. When the camera is in a tracking mode, any multi finger gesture with focal point inside the provided screen coordinate rectangle is not going to break the tracking.

        Best paired with the LocationComponentOptions.Builder.trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold(float) set to 0 or a relatively small value to not interfere with gestures outside of the defined rectangle.

        Returns:
        the protected multi finger area while camera is tracking

      • layerAbove

        public java.lang.String layerAbove()
        Gets the id of the layer that's referenced when placing the component on the map using Style.addLayerAbove(Layer, String).

        The component is going to placed directly above this layer.

        Returns:
        layerAbove the id of the layer the component is going to placed directly above.

      • layerBelow

        public java.lang.String layerBelow()
        Gets the id of the layer that's referenced when placing the component on the map using Style.addLayerBelow(Layer, String).

        The component is going to placed directly below this layer.

        Returns:
        layerBelow the id of the layer the component is going to placed directly below.

      • pulseFadeEnabled

        public java.lang.Boolean pulseFadeEnabled()
        Enable or disable fading of the LocationComponent's pulsing circle. If it fades, the circle's opacity decreases as its radius increases.
        Returns:
        whether fading of the LocationComponent's pulsing circle is enabled

      • pulseColor

        public java.lang.Integer pulseColor()
        Color of the LocationComponent's pulsing circle as it pulses.
        Returns:
        the current set color of the circle

      • pulseSingleDuration

        public float pulseSingleDuration()
        The number of milliseconds it takes for a single pulse of the LocationComponent's pulsing circle.
        Returns:
        the current set length of time for a single pulse

      • pulseMaxRadius

        public float pulseMaxRadius()
        The maximum radius that a single pulse should expand the LocationComponent's pulsing circle to.
        Returns:
        the maximum radius that the pulsing circle will expand to.

      • pulseAlpha

        public float pulseAlpha()
        The opacity of the LocationComponent's circle as it pulses. The expected range is 0 to 1. An opacity of 1 makes the layer fully visible.
        Returns:
        the current opacity of the LocationComponent's pulsing circle

      • pulseInterpolator

        @Nullable
public android.view.animation.Interpolator pulseInterpolator()
        The interpolator type of animation for the movement of the LocationComponent's circle
        Returns:
        the current set type of animation interpolator for the pulsing circle
